intro: Anil spinosa, commonly known as the spiny anil, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems covered in sharp spines. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the dry season. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a serrated margin, often with a strong, aromatic scent. Anil spinosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
